poem:
Title: "In Crimson Quills"

Bloody ink on silent parchment, victims voiceless scream
Sweeping truth under crimson rivers, unthinkable dream.
Cogs of Whitehall grinding, wheels in shrouded night,
A duplicity adorned in bandages of falsely soothing light.
Ghost pages whisper the unuttered tale,
In a mournful symphony, justice turns pale.
Tragedy scripted in cold, calculating veins,
In human hearts, the stain remains.
